DEAR FRIENDS! We welcome you to the joint March of Equality of Kyiv and Warsaw! These instructions will help you in preparing for the walk and spending time there in comfort! The provisions of this manual are recommendations that we have been in development during our 10 years of experience. Remember that the use of alcohol and psychoactive substances before the March or directly during the March poses a threat to your health and may cause inconvenience to people! Please take care of yourself and come to the March extremely sober! WHAT TO BRING WITH YOU? When preparing for the march, we advise you to bring the following things: 1. The original or copy of your identity document. 2. A small backpack to keep your hands free. 3. 1-2 small plastic bottles with water. 4. Snacks: energy bar, apple, some nuts or dried fruits, chocolate etc. 5. If you are taking any medication, bring enough pills for a few hours. 6 Assemble a simple first aid kit: bandage, wipes, antiseptic, etc 7. City map (preferably in electronic form), and a traffic schedule. 8. Water-based sunscreen (better to apply in advance). 9. Ukrainian symbols, as we are stepping for Ukraine in the first place. Everything you take with you should be as small and light in size as possible, so that the backpack does not restrict your movement later! WHAT CANNOT BE TAKEN? It is strictly forbidden to bring objects / means that may be dangerous: gas cylinders, weapons or objects that can be used as such, explosives and flammable objects, any pyrotechnics. It is recommended not to take animals with you. CLOTHES AND SHOES Shoes should be comfortable, in which you can walk a long distance and stand for a long time. Clothing: one that covers the body as much as possible. Try to avoid synthetics. We advise you to take a hat, it will protect you from the heat. To feel safer, you can take extra clothes, such as a T-shirt, to change after March.
